inclusion.criterion: Invasive mechanical ventilation using positive end expiratory pressure (PEEP) ≥ 5cmH2O
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Acute and potentially reversible cause of acute respiratory failure as determined by the treating physician
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Within 48 hours of the onset of hypoxemia as defined by Pa02/Fi02 less than or equal to 20kPA
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Intubated and mechanically ventilated via an endotracheal or tracheostomy tube ≥ 7 days up to the time of randomisation
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a 23-year-old man who came to the hospital with high blood pressure (175/95 mmHg) and signs of septicemia. He developed respiratory failure requiring mechanical ventilation and renal failure requiring hemodialysis.
